data.title: Samsung Galaxy S6
data.text:

Current: Android 7.0 "Nougat"System on chipSamsung Exynos 7420 Octa (14nm)CPUQuad-core 2.1 GHz Cortex-A57 + Quad-core 1.5 GHz Cortex-A53GPUMali-T760 MP8Memory3 GB RAMStorage32, 64 or 128 GBRemovable storagenoBattery2,550 mAh Li-ionDisplay5.1 in (130 mm) 2560x1440 Pixels (577 ppi) Quad HD Super AMOLED

Gorilla Glass 4Website[1]

The Samsung Galaxy S6, Galaxy S6 or just GS6 is an Android-based smartphone developed, manufactured, released and marketed by Samsung Electronics. It is the successor to the Samsung Galaxy S5 and the predecessor to the Samsung Galaxy S7. It was unveiled on March 1, 2015 with the Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge and released on April 5, 2015. On August 21, 2015, the Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge+ was released.

The Samsung Galaxy S6 gained good reviews.[1] It was critiziced for its battery, which is not able to keep the phone on as long as it could with the Samsung Galaxy S5. The battery can also no longer be replaced with a new battery, which means that as soon as the battery expires, the device will not function properly.[2]

The capacitive touch keys of the S6 sometimes do not work.[3] It is also possible that they do not light up[4] or the brightness of the light varies.

After one month, 10 million Samsung Galaxy S6 units were shipped, 6 million of them were sold.[5]

↑ "Samsung Galaxy S6".

↑ Hill, Simon. "Samsung Galaxy S6: 25 Problems and How to Fix Them". Digital Trends .

↑ "7 Strange Steps To Fix Back Button Not Working On Samsung Galaxy S6". Tech News, Smartphones, Gadgets, Reviews & How To's - TechRez. 2015-05-05. Archived from the original on 2020-05-20 .

↑ "Samsung Galaxy S6 And Galaxy S6 Edge: Touch Key Light Not Working". Tech Junkie .

↑ "Samsung Galaxy S6 Sales Fail To Break Records". InformationWeek .
